Fields.DialogueText: *KABOOM*
Hold steadfast until the last Morgana sinks beneath the waves!
*KABOOM*
Watashi ni makasete! Sagattero, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Stellar work as usual, Sōryū. Those Morganas didn't know what hit them.
Iissune ne, Kanchou! You have an adorable bodyguard forever at your side!
Have you always been so strong?
Mochiron! Mite, the blood of the dragon runs through my veins!
It is a fine tattoo... if questionably legal.
People have tried to cage dragons throughout history. Usually, they only try it once!

Fields.MenuText: How long did the tattoo take?

Fields.DialogueText: Upwards of nine hours with no breaks! It hurt, but boredom hurts worse.

Fields.MenuText: Did the tattoo hurt?

Fields.DialogueText: More than any Morgana has managed to - and I'd come back for more!

Fields.MenuText: Would you get any more tattoos?

Fields.DialogueText: There's a reason people say it's a addictive. They say tattoos should have meaning, too, and I'm a complicated girl!
Anyway, put that thing away before somebody sees and reports me!
Shōganai ne...
Good work today. That will be--
*BZZZZZ*
An incoming transmission?
Let me see what this is all about... Yes... yes... I don't think that's really necessary, but... I understand.
What was--?
It's our senior officers back on shore... They want to speak with you.
Hai... hai... wakarussu-- wakarimashita... hai, onegaishimasu.
That didn't sound fun.
Word has been received about our runaway pilot's joyride. I'm being punished for allowing him to fly without conducting the proper checks.
What?!
For endangering his life, apparently. Go figure. *Shrugs* Shall we go eat something? I'm starving!

Fields.MenuText: You're taking this surprisingly well.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm a carrier. What are they going to do? Behead me?

Fields.MenuText: Aren't you worried about being so nonchalant?

Fields.DialogueText: Whatever happens happens. If I couldn't take it on the chin, I'd never get anything done.

Fields.MenuText: Something tells me this isn't your first rodeo.

Fields.DialogueText: And it sure as hell won't be my last!
*ALARM*
Morganas!
Ikō, Kanchou! I need to blow off some steam!
@BATTLE
Oi, Kanchou! Care to join me?
Actually, I've been meaning to have a word with you as well. I've received word about your punishment...
You're still on that? Join me in the present and let it go. Here, try this new ramen the chef cooked up. Umaisssu, ne!
A chaperone will be sent to conduct a brief survey of your day-to-day actions. If they don't like what they see, they could take things higher.
I see... Is that all?! You had me worried for a minute there!
We both know it's highly unnecessary. I can call and put forward my case if--
Murishinaide. Better to let them think they have the power. That's when they get complacent.

Fields.MenuText: You're being surprisingly mature about all this.

Fields.DialogueText: Oho, Kanchou, are you falling for me? I wouldn't blame you.

Fields.MenuText: I like to think you'll still respect my authority.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! I can't think of a time when I haven't. At least as far as you know.

Fields.MenuText: Has this ever happened before?

Fields.DialogueText: Tokyo makes a lot of noise, but they've never sent someone out before. Mō, you endanger one senior pilot's life and suddenly you're enemy number one!
Regardless, they should arrive sometime within the week.
The week?! Gomen, Kanchou, I need to sort out my quarters before they arrive! The deck alone would get me thrown in the brig...
*ALARM*
Be a doll and handle those for me, would you?
*Fervent head shake, utter disbelief, painful sigh of acceptance*
@BATTLE
Out of the way!
*ZOOM*
Whoa! Steady, now! Where's the fire?
Oh, Kanchou! My bad, I didn't know it was you! I would have flashed a bigger smile.
How thoughtful... What's all that you're carrying?
I'm moving as many of my supplies as possible from my quarters down to the engine room.
Why's that?
So they aren't confiscated! That reminds me! We'll dock soon, right? Let's go shopping. My room's looking bare now and it's got me in that kind of mood.

Fields.MenuText: Is... Is that a katana...

Fields.DialogueText: Kinosei dayo, Kanchou! You must be seeing things. I'll bring you some tea later to quell that cabin fever of yours.

Fields.MenuText: Should I even ask what kind of things you're keeping hidden?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing baaaad. But would you really want to know?

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure whoever they send will have been informed about your… ways.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the point! They'll be looking for stuff to write me up for!
*ALARM*
Ah! Kanchou! Be a doll and--
Yeah, yeah, handle the Morganas.
What would I do without you?
What is it you actually do aboard this ship?
Hidoissu, Kanchou! These are extenuating circumstances! Right now, my job is to look pretty for the stuffed shirts. Azassu!
@BATTLE
Wah! Kimochiissune!
It is nice to touch land once in a while, even if we're here on business.
Kanchou, while we're docked, I was thinking of picking up some new guns. Would you be opposed?

Fields.MenuText: Let's get through your probation first before we start adorning the ship with even more ballistics...

Fields.DialogueText: Hm... I suppose you might be right...

Fields.MenuText: If you think it necessary, I'll trust your judgment.

Fields.DialogueText: Yatta! I'll pick out something extra special!
Anything else we need while docked?
Asoko ni.
Hm?
Chotto matte, Kanchou. I'm just going to check out that diving stall across the way.
Diving? I didn't know you were an avid swimmer.
There's likely a lot you still don't know about me, Kanchou. I'm looking forward to teaching you!
Don't be long.
Ussu! I'll be back in a moment. The Morganas will still be there!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't, but Command would. They're cracking down on improvised Belle stuff lately.

Fields.DialogueText: But they let Lexington make weird things!
*Used* to. That's part of the reason for the crackdown, actually.
You wanted to see me, Kanchou?
Yes, have a seat.
Can we make this quick? I'm pretty busy, you know?
This is for you.
Kanchou, you shouldn't have! I'm a little pissed you think today's my awakening day, but it's the thought that counts.
It's from our runaway pilot. I believe it was meant as a gift. It's a fine katana that looks to be purely decorative. Perhaps we could--
Tch! Gomi. Tsutette ii.
Sōryū?
It's pretentious to carry a sword around. Samurai culture's so passé. We should be blazing new trails in fashion!
Are you versed in the way of the sword?
Most Japanese Belles are. Fat load of good a blade is going to do if you're staring down the barrel of a thirty-two-inch Treason gun.

Fields.MenuText: How long have you trained?

Fields.DialogueText: As long as I can remember. I spar with Hiryū now and again, but I haven't been able to match her.

Fields.MenuText: Can you wield any other weapons?

Fields.DialogueText: Does my mouth count?

Fields.MenuText: I've never seen you wield a blade in battle.

Fields.DialogueText: Like I said, the way of the samurai is dead, and corpses tend to foul up the room if you keep them around.
There was no note, so I can only assume it was meant as a present. What would you have me do with it?
You know how I feel. I'll do what you think is best.
In that case, I'll abide by your wishes. It's too dangerous to be cast overboard, so I'll keep it here for you in case you change your mind about wanting to hold onto it.
Azassu...
*ALARM*
Morganas inbound!
Now let me show you how a real weapon fights!
@BATTLE
My chaperone should be arriving by aircraft at any moment now...

Fields.MenuText: Nervous?

Fields.DialogueText: Pfft! Who are you talking to?
*ALARM*
Let's quickly deal with these Morganas. Best we make a good impression.
@BATTLE
Is that him?
Looks to be. Play it cool.
The only way I know how!
Hello, it's very nice to--
Mhm, I'm sure it is. Let's skip the formalities and get straight down to brass tacks, shall we?
I am Captain Ryuji Sakamoto. You will refer to me as Captain Sakamoto unless instructed otherwise.
I will spend my time auditing your Belle while compiling a list of possible reasons for her termination. Is this the subject?

Fields.MenuText: What kind of person do you think they'll send?

Fields.DialogueText: Whoever it is, I'll have them wrapped around my finger in days.
Days?!
You're right, Kanchou. It didn't take so long for me to get you under my thumb, so maybe I could manage it in an afternoon.
Excuse me?
I mean...! Is that a new uniform, Kanchou? It suits you...

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure you don't want to cancel? I can delay.

Fields.DialogueText: We can't keep the higher-ups out of my business forever. Might as well get it over with.
Ossu, Ryuji-san! I'm--
You disgust me.
Sasen?
No traditional bow. Brazenly exposing an illegal tattoo. More meat on display than a butcher's window.
This is the new wave! Traditional fashion is for the traditionalists.
Do you plan on disciplining her?
She's not hurting anybody.
Thus far. I can see how she's become such a terror, being allowed to run rampant like this.
Kanchou said it's no problem, so--
You would do well to remember that you are here to do a job, not make friends. The captain is your superior officer, not a schoolyard chum.
Go about your business and I will attend to mine. Dismissed.
Not working on anything today, Sōryū?
Oh, Kanchou... Iie, I thought it best not to...
What happened to taking each scolding on the chin?
Tasshikani... I did say that, didn't I? ... This one felt a little different.
How so?
I don't have many friends, you know. Even Hiryū tends to avoid me. I always try my best for people, though! I try not to let a few harsh words get me down. It comes with the lifestyle, after all...
But...?
Maybe it just isn't enough...

Fields.MenuText: Don't think that way.
You've lived your life without anyone in your corner. Well, I won't let that happen again.
Don't just sit there and take punishment. Use it as fuel to rev up that engine!

Fields.DialogueText: You're right! Zenzen rasshikunai ne!
That was fast. I was ready to have a compelling dialogue about your mental fortitude...
No need! Like everything about me, Kanchou, even my moments of weakness are short and sweet!
*ALARM*
Now, let's work out some pent-up aggression!
@BATTLE
Oi~ Kanchou~!
You look to be in high spirits.
Mochiron! Check this out! It's the diving equipment I bought from the port. I've been working on some scuba gear in my spare time and thought it was about time they saw action!

Fields.MenuText: Bikes, planes, and now scuba gear... You're good at pretty much everything, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Haven't tried everything yet, but I'm working on it.

Fields.MenuText: Where did this love originate from?

Fields.DialogueText: Gotta do something to pass the time.

Fields.MenuText: Since when did you scuba dive?

Fields.DialogueText: I got the idea from one of the submarine girls. Something about being beneath the waves is so freeing. There's nothing like slowing down and sniffing the... algae?
Are there any other hidden talents I should know about?
Not that I can think of? I can play the sax a little, I suppose.
Again, this is the first I'm hearing about this.
Sounds to me like a "you" problem. I'm not responsible for what your ears can pick up. You should make sure they're listening whenever I'm speaking.
Will you play for me some time?
Ha?! Nani iitendayo, Kanchou...
Oho, does your fear of public speaking apply to public performance as well?
Baka! I'll go get my sax right now and play for you!
Please do.
Okay, I will!
*ALARM*
Kanch--!
Yeah, yeah, just get out of here.
Hmph!
@BATTLE
Jya, what do you think?
I'll happily eat my words! That was marvelous performance. I'd be keen to hear anything else you can play on the saxophone.
All right, all right, no need to get all sentimental...

Fields.MenuText: Do you play any other instruments?

Fields.DialogueText: I can play a traitor's teeth like a xylophone if that counts.

Fields.MenuText: What attracted you to the sax?

Fields.DialogueText: It's loud, bombastic, in your face, and can be heard from a mile away. Take a guess!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you could teach me sometime.

Fields.DialogueText: If you think you can handle it. I'm a pretty strict sensei!
What is that godforsaken racket?! Oh... I should have guessed.
Sasen, I didn't realize--
I'm not opposed to music by any means, but could you not have chosen a more traditional instrument? The shamisen, for example?
Anything can be Japanese if we make it our own.
Just keep it down!
*ALARM*
And do your job!
@BATTLE
Ugh! That Sakamoto is driving me crazy!
If you keep your head down, he'll be out of here before you know it.
I can try... I need to buy something to soundproof my quarters. Eight times he came knocking at my door last night. Eight!
Whatever for?
He said he wanted to check if I was sleeping. I told him I usually don't sleep until two or three in the morning. He may have knocked after that, but I was out like a light.
I won't hamper you. Go about your business.
Caaaan that business be buying new guns?

Fields.MenuText: Are you trying to get in trouble?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't need to try very hard, you know.

Fields.MenuText: If you can soundproof them somehow.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll do my best!
Quickly now. We're to send a pilot on his way soon and we need your seal of approval before he takes flight.
Jya, Kanchou, I'll leave the shopping to you while I clear out any Morganas blocking our exit!
Get to it!
Ussu!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Haven't I outfitted you with enough firepower?

Fields.DialogueText: If you have to ask, the answer's no.
Haaai.
Don't. I mean, do. I mean... just keep your head down.
One of those "I know it when I see it" things.
When I fire it and we list to starboard, yeah.
Uh-huh. Maybe once we're out of the spotlight.
Everything looks good. This baby's fit to fly.
That's all you warrant as a safety check?
I was up until 1 last night going over it, thank you very much. All it needs this morning is a kiss for good luck. *MWAH*
How abhorrent...

Fields.MenuText: It's good to see you back in your element.

Fields.DialogueText: It's good to be back, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Everything's okay? We won't have a repeat of last time?

Fields.DialogueText: Anshinshite, you won't be soaring through the sky anytime soon.

Fields.MenuText: That reminds me. Did you send thanks to the runaway pilot for his gift?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! If he wants my thanks, he can trade an apology for it in person.
You heard the lady, she's good to go!
*WHIRRRRRRR*
Everything looks--
*KSHHHHH*
The wheels have snapped!
Arienai...
So much for careful conduct! Get that man out of there!
*ALARM*
Perhaps you can redeem yourself by doing something right! Handle those Morganas while we ensure you haven't sent another pilot to their grave!
@BATTLE
Never in all my years of service have I seen such unabashed negligence in the line of duty!
Now, just you wait a minute--!
Take a look at this. This hasn't been mended, there are parts missing here, and a novice could see that this isn't in working order.
I'm telling you, before I went to bed, I signed off on this plane! My seal of approval is worth its weight in gold! Kanchou, you believe me, right?

Fields.MenuText: Of course!
Are you sure?
Maybe you were distracted?

Fields.DialogueText: I would never sign off on a plane that wasn't ready to fly!
Positive!
Tch! Thanks for the moral support...
My gripe is not with the captain, it is with you. Lazy; that's what you are. And what's more, you back up your unadulterated laxity with this abrasive attitude!
Clean it up and get back to work. While you still have work to get back to, that is.
Ussu...
Sōryū...
Forget it, Kanchou... I need some time to think...
*ALARM*
Sōryū...? "Be a doll and etcetera, etcetera?"
... Tch!
@BATTLE
I suppose you're wondering why I called you down here. I needed to speak with you privately.
I didn't think to question it. I'm just happy you're speaking to me again.
I was never irritated by you, Kanchou. I just needed time to clear my thoughts.
And did you manage it?
I've never seen things more clearly. Kanchou, there is no doubt in my mind that the plane was perfect before I went to sleep.
Right.
That suspension couldn't have snapped... unless someone messed with it. Someone had to have stolen a part.

Fields.MenuText: Why would someone do that?

Fields.DialogueText: Do you have any idea what you can get for aircraft parts? Especially from a ship that's awakened...

Fields.MenuText: That's a wild accusation to make without any proof.

Fields.DialogueText: Those are the best kinds, aren't they?

Fields.MenuText: Do you have any suspects?

Fields.DialogueText: Who's had it out for me since day one?
It has to have been Sakamoto! There's no one else aboard this ship who has it out for me as much as he does!
What do you propose we do?
I'm not one to waste time gathering trivial things like evidence and motives! My gut tells me all I need to know about him!
*ALARM*
If that's not an omen, I don't know what is! Hora, Kanchou, let's take out the intruders and confront Sakamoto!
@BATTLE
There you are!
You would do well to watch your tongue, young--
Oi, spare me the high and mighty act. We know what you did.
Is that so? Would you care to enlighten me?
You sabotaged me and that pilot for your own personal gain!
This is pathetic. I all but live in my office and you are free to ask any crewman here that walked past my windowed quarters if they saw me on that day. I didn't leave my seat.
Not for one second?
I was too busy writing up your recent antics to send to my superiors! I'll be sure to add this little accusation in as well.

Fields.MenuText: That's the alibi you're going with?

Fields.DialogueText: Like I said, you are free to interview any person aboard this ship. They will attest to my whereabouts on the given day.

Fields.MenuText: Sōryū wouldn't have been so careless.

Fields.DialogueText: Everything about the girl screams carelessness!

Fields.MenuText: You've had it out for her since you got here.

Fields.DialogueText: I've had it out for her lack of respect. I'm just here to do my job.
Wakanaissu...
*ALARM*
I'd best be off. Don't want to get caught in the crossfire. Do I need to tell you what to do next?
Daijōbusu...
DaijōbuDESU.
... Come on, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Hey don't look so glum. It doesn't suit you.
It's so frustrating! I just know he did it! I can feel it! Call it... dragon's instinct!

Fields.MenuText: I should have fought harder for you back there.

Fields.DialogueText: It wouldn't have helped. Don't beat yourself up about it.

Fields.MenuText: If you swear it, I'll follow you.

Fields.DialogueText: Azassu, Kanchou. Hontō, hontō.

Fields.MenuText: Mutiny is a flame born from a faint spark.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph. I wish he'd do a little more fainting.
*ALARM*
I have an idea. Let's take out these Morganas and get thinking of a way to catch this dirtbag red-handed.
Devious and a filthy mouth... Where has this Kanchou been all my life?
@BATTLE
So, how do you propose we catch this culprit?
There's got to be some kind of evidence in his room. A receipt of purchase in his jacket pocket from the part he sold or something.
Tasshikani. De wa, we'll sneak into his quarters, swipe the jacket, show him the proof, and send him back to the hellhole he came from!

Fields.MenuText: You haven't done this before, right? Say, in MY quarters?

Fields.DialogueText: Hm? No, no, no! Never! By the way, that letter from your mother was just about her next dental appointment. Nothing to worry about.

Fields.MenuText: How will we get away with it? Without being caught.

Fields.DialogueText: You'll be my lookout.

Fields.MenuText: We could get in real trouble doing this.

Fields.DialogueText: Isn't that half the fun?
*ALARM*
We know our assignments. Let's take out the Morganas and move out!
Ussu!
@BATTLE
I can't believe we got away with that!
*ALARM*
No time to get complacent. Put Sakamoto's jacket down over there and we'll check the contents after dealing with the Morganas.
@BATTLE
Bingo da!
You've found something?!
A receipt of purchase for one set of aircraft parts addressed to one Ryuji "Snake-in-the-grass" Sakamoto!

Fields.MenuText: I never doubted you for a second!

Fields.DialogueText: Really?

Fields.MenuText: Do you know where he is?

Fields.DialogueText: ... So, what shall we do now? Confront him?
I saw Sakamoto earlier today. He told me my motorcycle was an eyesore and he'll be moving it out from the deck.

Fields.MenuText: Out of curiosity, how much did he make off the sale?

Fields.DialogueText: Grr... Less than I would have charged, that's for damn sure!
The one with the passenger car or the one without?
The one without. I was working on it a little more today since our dual-rider is up and running.
So, you spoke with Sakamoto, who told you he'd be moving your bike somewhere safe...
Kanchou... We recently docked into a port, didn't we...?
That we did...
And Sakamoto is no slouch when it comes to these kinds of things, is he...?
The man's a criminal mastermind...
We should probably get moving.
Go, go, go!
Sakamoto!
Ah. There you are. I was wondering when you would show up.
Get off that bike, Sakamoto!
*Sigh* It's a shame I had to be found out like this. And by such a cretinous girl at that.

Fields.MenuText: How did you orchestrate this?

Fields.DialogueText: It was surprisingly easy to make my rounds, converse with the crew and snag the part.
Poor lad only wanted to feel like a senior officer for a moment. I hope the conspiracy charge is worth it.
A rube of an ensign I dressed in my uniform.

Fields.MenuText: You won't get away with it!

Fields.DialogueText: I've been in this racket for quite some time. Who will they believe, an insubordinate menace or an esteemed member of the naval officer corps?
How did you do it...?

Fields.MenuText: So, the knocking at Sōryū's door...?

Fields.DialogueText: The knocking on Sōryū's door was to check when she sleeps. After three in the morning is when I do my best work.
How did you do it...?
The knocking on Sōryū's door was to check when she sleeps. After three in the morning is when I do my best work.
It was surprisingly easy to make my rounds, converse with the crew, and snag the part.
A rube of an ensign I dressed in my uniform.
Poor lad only wanted to feel like a senior officer for a moment. I hope the conspiracy charge is worth it.
Most crew roll over after a tongue-lashing or two and allow me to get to business. I should have guessed a Belle would put up much more of a fight.
Sakamoto, teme...!
Must dash. Be sure to not to try too hard on the report outing me. I'll only have it intercepted, after all. Mata ne~
*VROOOOM*
Hayaku, Kanchou! We have to give chase! To the passenger bike!
What about the Morganas advancing on the port?
Thank goodness for them or the port wouldn't be locked down. We'll grab Sakamoto once the danger is over!
@BATTLE
But... how could you have been in two places at once?
But... how could you have been in two places at once?
We're nearly done with the Morganas, Kanchou! Then we can finally chase after that thieving Sakamoto!
@BATTLE
*VROOOM*
Asoko ni, Kanchou! Don't let him fire his ride up!
Watch out!
*PANG*
Kono yaro! He has a pistol!

Fields.MenuText: We can talk about it, Sakamoto!

Fields.DialogueText: It's too late for talking, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: We can help you!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm far beyond help! This is all I've ever known! It's too late to change!

Fields.MenuText: You're going to get yourself killed!

Fields.DialogueText: It's a Type 97! It flirts with a hundred kilometers! We have to blast him before he--
How fast can that thing go?
Why does everyone we meet have a death wish, Kanchou?! Is it me? Would people rather die than be with me?!
Of course not!
Do I smell?! You can tell me if I do!
None of that! Do you want to take the port with him?
... Wait. Kanchou. That road... it runs parallel to the coast!
What's your point?
Quick! Get the cops to close off every road out but that one! How close can we get?
*sigh* I said I would support you from now on. How fast can your other motorcycle go?
Fast enough. Hang on, Kanchou! It's about to get bumpy!
I'm always serious.
... You're not serious.
*VROOOM*
Soko ni, Kanchou! I'm going to jump! Ittekimasu!
You learned from the best! Itterashai!
Ha!
*CLANG*
*Thud*
Stay back!
Oi, get that pistol outta my face before you hurt yourself.
*BANG*
*SCHWING*
*Thud*
A katana...?

Fields.MenuText: Where did that come from?

Fields.DialogueText: It's our runaway pilot's gift. I guess it wasn't decorative after all.

Fields.MenuText: I don't remember you picking that up?

Fields.DialogueText: Just be glad this didn't escalate. I can't draw any more weapons without getting indecent.

Fields.MenuText: Is it over?

Fields.DialogueText: It is now.
Tch! Since when were you so versed in the ways of the katana?
Looks like I'm not as out of touch as you thought.
I dont hate my ancestors or what they created, Sakamoto. I want to emulate their genius by creating something new!
Unwillingness to change is what led you down this path of crime. And it will be your undoing.
Well said.
Let's return to the ship, Kanchou. I'm sure the Morganas have been piling up. We'll take Sakamoto into custody.
That jump... how did you do it? I thought Belles couldn't leave their--
@BATTLE
Sōryū, he's getting away! Your top speed won't be enough!
Quit talking about it and point me toward him!
Stop him or he's out of your range! Make it count!
What can I say? My bike's built different.
What a ride, ne, Kanchou?
Sakamoto's been taken into custody, you've been issued a formal apology... and I, miraculously, didn't lose my job for allowing it all to take place!
Azassu, Kanchou... For being in my corner.
Don't mention it. Actually, it's got me thinking.
Hm?
I really want to do... THAT... with you...
Nani?
*Whisper whisper*
Kanchou! How bold! Where did that come from?

Fields.MenuText: You only live once.

Fields.DialogueText: Seconded!

Fields.MenuText: It sounds fun.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I can certainly attest to that.

Fields.MenuText: If it's with you, I'm sure I'll be fine.

Fields.DialogueText: How sweet. Although, the way I do it might be a little bit painful.
*ALARM*
Let's deal with the Morganas and get down to it.
@BATTLE
Are you sure about this, Kanchou?
Be gentle.
Ganbaru.

Fields.MenuText: Can you hold my hand during?

Fields.DialogueText: Stop being such a baby!

Fields.MenuText: Ah! Not so rough!

Fields.DialogueText: Sit back and let me do my job!

Fields.MenuText: Can't you do it any faster?

Fields.DialogueText: I can do it fast or I can do it right!
*SOME TIME LATER*
Owatta! Otsukare!
Phew! I'm exhausted!
*ALARM*
Do you think I'll be all right to take on the Morganas in this state?
You might be a little tender, but I'm sure you'll be fine!
@BATTLE
How does it look?
The tattoo came out great, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: So, we should add "tattooist" to your list of achievements.

Fields.DialogueText: I've had the kit burning a hole in my quarters for ages. It's nice to finally be able to use it!

Fields.MenuText: It didn't hurt as much as I thought it would.

Fields.DialogueText: Your teary eyes tell a different story. Try sitting for nine hours through your next one!

Fields.MenuText: I can see how this could become addicting.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's start planning your next one!
Still, I'm not quite sure why you wanted a plane. I would have thought a ship or an anchor would suit you better.
In honor of the Belle that inspired my decision!
But it's tiny!
That isn't the point! The only one who's ever going to see it is you!
Did you hear me?
*ALARM*
I have to go and do something! Be a--
Doll.
Handle--
The Morganas.
You're--
The best.
I was going to say aggravating. Repeating is so childish.
@BATTLE
A small mosquito bite on your shoulder is hardly going to strike fear into the hearts of your enemies.
It was also painted on while you simulated the pain. That rug burn's no joke, by the way.
Sure does make me appreciate the real thing, though.
Kanchou! I'm back!
The Morganas haven't let up! Care to join us?
With pleasure!
@BATTLE
So, where did you rush off to?
Jya jyaaaan!
Is that... Did you just tattoo yourself during that last battle?!
You should know by now, Kanchou. Speed is the name of my game!
What...
It's a parachute. On the opposite shoulder to your plane.
But my tattoo isn't real! We decided to simulate the pain and use watercolors for easy removal!
Doesn't matter. It's there to remind myself that, even when I feel like I'm falling, I'll always have someone there to catch me.
Sōryū... How nice.
I should say so! When I imagined *you* falling hundreds of feet, I almost screwed up my line work from laughing so hard!

Fields.MenuText: That's less nice...

Fields.DialogueText: "Help me, help me! I'm going to die!" You kill me, Kanchou! Have you ever considered a career in stand-up? Or, in your case, "fall-down!"

Fields.MenuText: I'll always be there to catch you.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll hold you to that!

Fields.MenuText: Don't tell anyone about this. I could lose my job.

Fields.DialogueText: What's the point in having a tattoo if you aren't going to show it off?! Oh well, I guess I can keep my mouth shut just this once.
You were right about what you said before.
I say so many "right" things, Kanchou, you'll have to remind me.
Change is coming. Tradition is all very well and good, but the new era is here and it's ours for the taking!
We're bound to get in a lot of trouble for following this path, Kanchou.
That's half the fun, isn't it?
Ussu!
